problem_text: Suppose that a is a non-trivial element of a finite group G such that |CG(a)| ⩾ |CG(x)| for every non-trivial element x ∈ G, and let H be a nilpotent subgroup of G which is normalized by CG(a). Is it true that H ⩽ CG(a)? This is true if H is abelian, or if H is a p′-group for some prime number p ∈ π(Z(CG(a))). I. T. Mukhamet’yanov, A. N. Fomin
